result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Haynes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.  Consecutive to any other sentence.
12/12/16 COURT GRANTS MOTION THAT DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Contribution of $200.00 to Crime Stoppers to be paid before costs or fines.

No Contact with Associated Bank in Menomonee Falls or the bank teller involved in the incident or with passenger in vehicle in incident. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained, surcharge is imposed. Maintain absolute sobriety, comply with random urine screens. No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Restitution for Crime Stoppers to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision before costs or fines.

Defendant Michael Haynes in court, in custody, with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  Both parties recite corrections to presentence investigation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kay makes statements regarding sentencing.  Diane C. makes statements on behalf of Defendant.  Hattie H. makes statements on behalf of Defendant.  Defendant makes statements. Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

16 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)     **Consecutive to any other sentence**
  -  12 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   4 YEARS  OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Associated Bank in Menomonee Falls or bank teller involved in incident or with passenger in vehicle in incident
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done

$200.00 contribution to Crime Stoppers (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)


COUNT #2:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)   **Consecutive to Count #1 and any other sentence**
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Associated Bank in Menomonee Falls or bank teller involved in incident or with passenger in vehicle in incident
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done


COSTS:  $268.00  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Sentencing hearing on June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Haynes in court, in custody, with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information. Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #1 & 2 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2 on amended information.  State requests a presentence investigation.  Attorney Kay joins in request.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Sentencing date is set.   Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to be returned forthwith.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Dodge Correctional for 5/8/15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
